section: BACKGROUND: A. The Members wish to enter into an association of mutual benefit and agree to jointly invest and set up a joint venture enterprise. B. This Agreement sets out the terms and conditions governing this association.
explanation: This section, while seemingly innocuous, introduces ambiguity regarding the specific nature of the 'association.' It states an intent to 'jointly invest and set up a joint venture enterprise,' but the term 'association of mutual benefit' is vague and undefined. This could lead to disputes later if the parties disagree on the scope and nature of their collaborative efforts. Furthermore, it's not clear what weight is given to the 'association of mutual benefit', and if this is a legally binding aspect of the agreement. This is especially relevant because the document doesn't fully clarify the liabilities associated with each venture, which can cause confusion.

section: The exclusive purpose of the Venture (the "Purpose") will be IT Development. internet Back office Maintenance And Deployment of medical Service.
explanation: The text is not structured properly and does not make sense because it is not clear. The phrase "IT Development. internet Back office Maintenance And Deployment of medical Service" is written with poor grammatical structure. It is difficult to understand what the specific responsibilities are. This could lead to arguments down the line.

section: Each Member will be responsible for its respective duties as follows: Page 3 of 13 Member Duties Description BorrowMoney.com, inc *HTML code, build, deploy and maintain all technical aspect requirements including a database for medical dispatch personal & product service as needed, including activity information, data storage and backup. provided by three qualified assigned Borrowmoney.com, inc. employees/personal JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD To be paid within 90 days of signing this agreement. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue From Awarded Contract, In Addition to The Total Contributions.
explanation: The description of BorrowMoney.com, inc's duties lacks specificity. Using the phrase 'HTML code, build, deploy and maintain all technical aspect requirements' does not set clear performance standards. What happens if there is a dispute of what 'all technical aspect requirements' includes? This section does not specify the level of performance that must be reached to fulfill this obligation. The number of employees for Borrowmoney.com to provide is also unclear. It states 'three qualified assigned Borrowmoney.com, inc employees/personal' - the 'personal' should be 'personnel'.

section: Each of the Members has contributed to the capital of the Venture, in cash or property in agreed upon value, as follows (the "Capital Contribution"): Member Contribution Description Agreed Value BorrowMoney.com, inc 1, 500 square feet of Leased/rent office Space Includingspecified Description of duty* $3,500,000.00 USD JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD in cash. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue, In Add i t i on to The To ta l Contributions. $3,500,000.00 USD
explanation: This section contains several issues. Firstly, it assigns a monetary value of $3,500,000.00 USD to '1,500 square feet of Leased/rent office Space Includingspecified Description of duty'. This valuation seems extremely high for leased office space. It's not clear what the 'specified Description of duty' refers to, creating ambiguity. Secondly, JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go contributes '$60,000.00 USD in cash. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue, In Addition to The Total Contributions' and is also assigned a value of $3,500,000.00 USD. This is a major discrepancy. The initial contribution of $60,000 plus a percentage of revenue does not equal a $3,500,000.00 contribution. Finally, the phrase 'In Add i t i on to The To ta l Contributions' is redundant and does not make sense given the context.

section: In the absence of a written agreement setting a value, the value of the Venture will be determined based on the total revenue generated over the last 3 months. An appraiser will be appointed within a reasonable period of the date of withdrawal or dissolution. The results of the appraisal will be binding on all Members. A withdrawing Member's interest will be based on the proportion of their respective capital account less any outstanding liabilities a Member may have to the Venture. The intent of this section is to ensure the survival of the Venture despite the withdrawal of any individual Member.
explanation: The method of valuation described here is problematic and may not comply with standard business valuation practices. Basing the value of the entire venture solely on 'total revenue generated over the last 3 months' is a simplistic approach that ignores other critical factors such as profitability, assets, liabilities, and market conditions. A standard business valuation would typically consider a much wider range of financial metrics and industry benchmarks. Further more, is the company generating profit or loss over the last three months? The valuation does not take the business model of the company into account and would be very difficult to implement.

section: Where joint ventures are not recognized by statute as separate legal entities, Venture property, including intellectual property, will be held in the name of one or more Members. In all cases Venture property will be applied by the Members exclusively for the benefit and purposes of the Venture and in accordance with this Agreement.
explanation: This is an ambiguity in a legal term. The section states that when joint ventures are not recognized as separate legal entities, Venture property will be held in the name of one or more members. However, it does not explicitly address which member or how the ownership is split between members. This lack of clarification creates uncertainty and the potential for disputes over property rights. Also, it does not state how the Venture property will be held in the name of one or more Members. For example, what happens if one of the members dies? This becomes confusing.
